intro: Chazaliella coffeosperma, commonly known as the coffee-fruited chazalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing aromatic, coffee-scented seeds. Its foliage consists of elliptical leaves with a hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique scent and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
